modules.description: This module implements book search and retrieval operations using the Amazon Product Advertising API. It provides functions to search for books by criteria, fetch all results across multiple pages, and retrieve books by ISBN, returning structured data in a list or option monad. The module works with credentials, search criteria, and book data types defined in related modules.

This module defines a polymorphic variant type representing supported Amazon locales such as Brazil, Canada, China, and others. It provides functions to convert between locale values and their string or S-expression representations. These conversions are used to specify regional Amazon endpoints when querying the Product Advertising API for book data.

This module defines core data structures for representing books, including detailed pricing and image information. It provides types for book metadata such as ISBN, title, author, and publisher, along with nested types for price and image variants. These definitions support concrete use cases like book cataloging, price comparison, and image handling in book-related applications.

This module validates and converts ISBN numbers, supporting both 10 and 13-digit formats with automatic dash removal. It provides functions to convert ISBNs to and from strings, validate their check digits, and convert between ISBN-10 and ISBN-13 representations when possible. Use cases include parsing user input, ensuring ISBN integrity in a book database, and converting ISBN formats for external API interactions.

This module implements book information retrieval using the Amazon Product Advertising API. It provides functions to construct AWS credentials and search criteria for querying book data by title, author, publisher, or keywords. The module works with polymorphic variant locales, credential records, and criteria types to support region-specific book searches requiring AWS authentication.

This module implements functions for querying Amazon's book database using HTTP requests and XML parsing. It provides operations to search for books by criteria, retrieve specific pages of results, fetch all matching books, and look up books by ISBN. These functions work with credentials, search criteria, ISBNs, and book records, returning results in a monadic context to handle asynchronous or error-prone operations.
